intro: Cavendishia davidsei, commonly known as the David's Cavendish, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup. The plant produces striking inflorescences with vibrant, showy flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
